article_title: Survey: Number without health insurance in R.I. drops to 5 percent
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox

article_metadata.description:
The number of Rhode Islanders who lack health insurance has dropped by more than half --  from about 113,000 to 50,000 -- since 2012, according to the results of a state-commissioned survey announced on Thursday.
The drop in the rate of the uninsured to just 5 percent coincided with the passage of the Affordable Care Act, which took effect in 2014 and spurred Rhode Island to expand Medicaid and open HealthSource RI, the state-based health insurance exchange.
About 82,000 people were
article_metadata.author: Richard Salit
